intro: Phyllanthus betsileanus, commonly known as the Betsilean gooseberry, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are edible and often consumed by local communities. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
